title: How to Make Gluten Free Zucchini Cornbread

steps.headline: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt and brown sugar.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, egg and melted butter until the mixture becomes smooth.
Pour the buttermilk mixture into the flour mixture and stir it all together until it's just combined.
Add the zucchini to the mixture and stir to evenly distribute it.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it out evenly.
Allow it to cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
Once it's cooled slightly, remove the bread from the dish and set it on a wire rack to cool for another 15 to 20 minutes.
Slice the bread into thick slices and serve with fresh butter.

text: Preparing the Batter In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt and brown sugar.  In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, egg and melted butter until the mixture becomes smooth.  Pour the buttermilk mixture into the flour mixture and stir it all together until it's just combined. Don't over mix. Add the zucchini to the mixture and stir to evenly distribute it.  Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it out evenly.  Cooling and Serving Allow it to cool in the pan for 10 minutes.  Once it's cooled slightly, remove the bread from the dish and set it on a wire rack to cool for another 15 to 20 minutes.  Slice the bread into thick slices and serve with fresh butter.
